オプション1: The three of them gathered in Trapezoid Man’s room.
"…Today, I made a deal with a demon."

"If I hadn’t, I would’ve died. I had no choice.
The contract brought me back from death—but I’ll die one year from now."
(I think I messed that up... How should I have said it...?)
"Wh-what...?"
Trapezoid Man and the others struggled to grasp what they had just heard.

"When I was attacked by a monster and about to die,
a horned man appeared and offered me a contract. I had no choice but to accept."
Star Man conjured fire from his hand.
"As proof of the pact with the demon—I can now use magic."
"I want us to set a goal—escape this island within a year."
"Wha... no way... that can't be real..."

Trapezoid Man couldn’t wrap his head around it right away,
but the kids, on the other hand, accepted it immediately.
After that, over a meal of acorns, they talked about the horned man, the ghost, the magic, and the little bottles.
"Oh, right. I brought part of a monster with me."
Star Man pulled out a leaf and unfolded it. Everyone leaned in to look.
"Smells like a factory... I feel sick just sniffing it..."
All three of them grimaced.
"Tomorrow, while I’m out gathering acorns, I’ll also look to see if there are any islands nearby."
"Got it. I... I'm sorry, but there's nothing I can really do..."

"It's okay. Don't worry about it.
I'll have Triangle Man and Rectangle Man gather coconuts."
"Okay."
"Throw rocks at the coconuts, knock them down, and gather them up."
"Okaaay!"
"Be very careful, okay?"
"They always hit you on the head, right? Haha!"
